page.title: 06Beetham Hall Farm.
page.content: Beetham Hall was a fortified Manor but is now a farm. It has changed alot since it was mentioned in the Domesday Book. Mr.Savages day begins at 6 a.m. for milking and this is repeated at 5 p.m.He has Fresian cows,a Limazan bull and some sheep. About 7 a.m. he has his breakfast of bacon and egg then they get on with farm work such as mucking out. The land is used for grazing and silage production .They do not have many workers, because they now use modern farming equipment. Under the old oak staircase is a strange door which opens on its own accord at the strangest time. They think it is a ghost.
